result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Darren J Bishop in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CM92, 14CM93, 14CM109, 14CM110, 14CM115, 15CF12, 15CF13.  
14CF106-INIT APP, PTC, PH-waive reading of CC.
DE will waive prelim hearing in 14CF106, court instructs on waiver of prelim.  Court will accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause exists, will bind over for JT.  Will proceed to arraignment, waive reading and enter a plea of NG.  DE will withdraw speedy resolution request at this time.  Court will accept withdrawal of request.

15CF12, 15CF13-waive reading of CC.  Waive time limits for prelim hearings on these cases.  Court instructs on waiver of time limits.  Set after July 22 for reason stated by DE.  Set  7-28-15 @ 10:00PM, will mark off 2 hours.
